title: Changed up the visual design of our sales posts.  What do you think?
body:
Hey guys,

If you pop over to [the most recent sales post](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/store/sales/champion-and-skin-sale-118-1111) you may notice that it looks different than [our sales up to this point](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/store/sales/champion-and-skin-sale-1105-1108).  Upgrading the layout of our sales posts is something my team has wanted to do for a while since we publish them twice a week, but it took a while to finish a sales redesign between evaluation of heavier content, where ineffective layouts present a higher risk.

Our primary goal with the redesign was to make the posts **efficient** and **informative**.  Here are a few of the changes we've made:

* Called out the 50% discount rate
* Converted the names of champions into links to their information pages
* Added lightboxing to all images
* Reorganized the champion section to 1 row x 3 columns



Let us know how the new look is working out for you!  I've attached a side-by-side of the old sales layout and the new one for easier comparison.

*Warning: The fullsize image is 2160 x 2940 px (2.4 MB)*

replies.body:
Definitely cleaner, definitely more efficient. Mission accomplished there!

From a general sales standpoint, I do wonder why you don't also show the original price to show the amount saved if they buy it now/then. I am not a salesperson or business guy at all though so it's really just curiosity on my part.
I'll ask ecommerce about this; from a technical standpoint it's simple to do.
People always love seeing the ~~full price~~ **sale price**.
Happy to help, good luck!

Not sure what else there's to say.

The new look just looks clean and simple.

I would suggest you link the champion splash that you are encouraging people to buy to the actual champion page so they can easily see what the champion is all about.

Plus, after all that hard work on the champion page design it will get some traffic over there.

An earlier version did this but we replaced it with lightboxing.  The standard expectation on LoL.com is that clickable images link to full-sized views (eg screenshots in new skin announcements) but that rule may be bendable in this case since the loading screen banners aren't the same as full splash images anyway.

I have to echo that it's more intuitive to have the champion lightboxes link to the actual champion page.  Here's why: the purpose of the page is to advertise a sale, with all the pricing and related information shown.  We're not buying a picture of the champion; we're buying the champion himself, so having it link to "what you're selling" when a potential buyer is curious makes the most sense and feels right for the buyer.  Considering that no sales can be conducted outside the client, may as well link to the best "marketing" page you have so the buyer will salivate about the on-sale champ.

I totally get that, but I'm thinking the champion page has that splash in the background AND all the champ information which is what you want to see when trying to figure out if you want to play a champion or not.
Then why not simply putting a link the the comment area.

The cleanup is awesome knowing the goals you had in mind. While I'm a lorehound and absolutely loved the fun stories, I understand that they can be obnoxious for other people who just want to get to the point.  Also the lightboxing is really nice and clean, makes a much bigger difference than I expected it to.  Overall, I can't find any complaints into issues you guys were addressing, but I will dearly miss the stories.
ya thye looook cool simple adn cool
Looks great! With all the website, community beta, and pre-season changes, Riot is doing some really quality work (in my humble opinion).

I have to say that I love the cleaner look and light boxes FTW! I hated it when target="_blank". So annoying to have images opening in new tabs. 

{{summoner:1}} {{champion:22}}  Cleanse all the slows!

One thing that's kind of annoying for me (I'm at work atm so the monitor is fairly small) is clicking the art to open the splash makes the artwork expand the page past my viewing area, and just clicking the background doesn't remove the image, so I have to manually scroll over the bottom right of the image and click the X everytime I look at a full splash.
Good feedback on lightboxing.  I'll pass it along to our developers.
I like it! You guys make it less cluttered! {{champion:64}}

I approve. It looks cleaner, takes up less space and having a full splash art for a sale seemed to be a moot/redundant point.

Good work.

Here is what I find good in the new layout for sales:

This design looks better agregated;  
Accomodates smaller screens (mobiles, tablets, etc.)better by shortening the length of the page  
Has better focus on the champion on sale itself by limiting the splash image to the champion itself  

The rest is already mentioned up there with the integrated links and the better visibility of the prices.

[This](http://br.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_medium/public/upload/20131108_champskinsalebr.jpg?itok=z96_Jrg8) from [here](http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/1q3ltb/champion_and_skin_sale_1108_1111/) Is IMO enough.
